content.text:
# Endorsements in the 1988 Republican Party presidential primaries

This is a list of endorsements for declared candidates in the Republican primaries for the 1988 United States presidential election.
George H. W. Bush
Withdrawn candidates
Bob Dole
*Al D'Amato, U.S. Senator from New York (1981–1999)
*Pete Domenici, U.S. Senator from New Mexico (1973–2009)
*David Durenberger, U.S. Senator from Minnesota (1978–1995)
*Chuck Grassley, U.S. Senator from Iowa (1981–present)
*Nancy Kassebaum, U.S. Senator from Kansas (1978–1997)
*Frank Murkowski, U.S. Senator from Alaska (1981–2002)
*Don Nickles, U.S. Senator from Oklahoma (1981–2005)
*Larry Pressler, U.S. Senator from South Dakota (1979–1997)
*Warren Rudman, U.S. Senator from New Hampshire (1980–1993)
*Robert Stafford, U.S. Senator from Vermont (1971–1989)
*Steve Symms, U.S. Senator from Idaho (1981–1993)
*Paul Trible, U.S. Senator from Virginia (1983–1989)
; U.S. House of Representatives
*Rod Chandler, WA-08 (1983–1993)
*Steve Gunderson, WI-03 (1981–1997)
*Amo Houghton, NY-34 (1987–1993), NY-31 (1993–2003), NY-29 (2003–2005)
*Andy Ireland, FL-08 (1977–1983), FL-10 (1983–1993)
*Jim Jeffords, VT at-large (1975–1989)
*John Kasich, OH-12 (1983–2001)
*Al McCandless, CA-37 (1983–1993), CA-44 (1993–1995)
*Jan Meyers, KS-03 (1985–1997)
*John Porter, IL-10 (1980–2001)
*Pat Roberts, KS-01 (1981–1997)
*Marge Roukema, NJ-07 (1981–1983), NJ-05 (1983–2003)
*Pat Saiki, HI-01 (1987–1991)
*Daniel Schaefer, CO-06 (1983–1999)
*Bob Smith, OR-02 (1983–1995; 1997–1999)
*Denny Smith, OR-02 (1981–1983), OR-05 (1983–1991)
*Arlan Stangeland, MN-07 (1977–1991)
*Bill Thomas, CA-18 (1979–1983), CA-20 (1983–1993), CA-21 (1993–2003), CA-22 (2003–2007)
*Bob Whittaker, KS-05 (1979–1991)
; Governors
*Mike Hayden, 41st Governor of Kansas (1987–1991)
*George S. Mickelson, 28th Governor of South Dakota (1987–1993)
; Statewide officials
*Robert H. Lounsberry, 11th Secretary of Agriculture of Iowa (1973–1977)
; State legislators
Georgia House of Representative
*Johnny Isakson, Cobb County (1977–1991) and Minority Leader (1983–1991)
Illinois House of Representatives
*Lee A. Daniels, IL-40 (1975–1983), IL-46 (1983–2007) and Minority Leader (1983–1995; 1997–2003)
Iowa Senate
*Calvin Hultman, IA-49 (1973–1983) ,IA-47 (1983–1991) and Minority Leader
; Party officials
*Stephen W. Roberts, chair of the Republican Party of Iowa
}}
Pete du Pont
; State legislators
Iowa House of Representatives
*Del Stromer, IA-86 (1967–1971), IA-08 (1971–1973), IA-09 (1973–1983), IA-17 (1983–1991) and Minority Leader
}}
Al Haig
; Notable individuals
*George Allen, football coach
*Billy Dee Williams, actor
}}
Jack Kemp
; U.S House of Representatives

*Beau Boulter, TX-13 (1985–1989)
*Hank Brown, CO-04 (1981–1991)
*Dan Burton, IN-06 (1983–2003), IN-05 (2003–2013)
*Dan Coats, IN-04 (1981–1989)
*Jim Courter, NJ-13 (1979–1983), NJ-12 (1983–1991)
*William Dannemeyer, CA-39 (1979–1993)

; Notable individuals
